image.altText: The couple stands together in front of a microphone

props.synopsis: Debra and Martin Robinson, the parents of Perth brothers Jake and Callum who were killed in Mexico, speak about losing their sons.

title.children: 'Now it's time to bring them home': Parents of Australian brothers killed in Mexico speak for the first time

image.altText: Mitchell (1)

props.synopsis: Stephen Mitchell was sentenced to 13 years in jail for abusing six girls during his time as a national rock climbing coach, but his sentence may be reduced after a hearing this week.

title.children: This convicted child sex abuser could get his prison sentence reduced. It has prompted calls for changes in the law

image.altText: Electric Fields vocalist Zaachariaha Fielding in a dress and Fred Leone playing the Yidaki

props.synopsis: In a massive upset, Australia has been knocked out of Eurovision. Electric Fields vocalist Zaachariaha Fielding and producer and keyboardist Michael Ross's song brings the Yankunytjatjara language to the competition for the first time.

title.children: In a massive upset, Australia's Electric Fields misses out on Eurovision grand final

image.altText: A composite of Canberra bushland, Sydney beaches and a cityscape in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: The index looks at seven wellbeing indicators including wealth, employment, and work-life balance. Find out where your region ranks.

title.children: One state dominates the top 10 places to live in Australia, new data shows

image.altText: Middle-aged woman smiles and rests her chin on her hands. She wears diamond rings on her fingers and and diamond earrings

props.synopsis: Terry was diagnosed with early-onset Alzheimer's disease in her 50s. This is her daughter's message to anyone going through the same experience.

title.children: The 'strange' behaviours that led to Terry's dementia diagnosis at age 54

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks into a microphone in front of a sign that says BEEF 2024

props.synopsis: In the week before the budget, Anthony Albanese is deliberately heading to places where people have beef with him, and the inner-city PM seems surprisingly at home on Peter Dutton's home turf.

title.children: Everyone has beef with the PM this week. But he seemed surprisingly at home chewing the fat in Dutton country

image.altText: A toddler sits on the ground inside a tent, looking on, with his hand over his mouth, while several relatives sit behind

props.synopsis: Aid agencies warn of a humanitarian catastrophe as Israeli forces seize the Palestinian side of the Rafah crossing in southern Gaza and close the flow of aid through the checkpoint.

title.children: Gaza aid 'choked off' after Israel seizes Rafah border crossing

image.altText: A crayon sketch depicting a woman in a suit sitting in a court room stand with a judge looking down at her

props.synopsis: The former adult film star offers jurors a graphic account of an alleged sexual encounter with the former US president she says she was paid to be quiet about.

title.children: Stormy Daniels gives graphic account of sexual encounter with Trump during hush money trial

image.altText: A picture of a tram at a stop, a pedestrian bridge to the stop and cars driving past.

props.synopsis: The federal government is showing its support for Stage 2B of Canberra's light rail by committing $50 million to planning the 10-kilometre extension from Commonwealth Park to Woden.

title.children: Federal government throws support behind Canberra's light rail Stage 2B with $50 million committed to planning

image.altText: A woman films herself being sexually harassed from a speeding car

props.synopsis: The head of the National Women's Safety Alliance is outraged by harassment and victim blaming after a footy fan captures threats of sexual violence against her on camera.

title.children: Footy fan Hayley Mabbett was sexually harassed on her way home from a game. She caught it on camera

image.altText: A woman who holds a stack of papers in an office.

props.synopsis: Consumers are being further squeezed by expensive phone bills as Australia's biggest telcos hike prices in response to inflation and rising operational costs.

title.children: Millions of Australians brace for higher phone bills as telcos hike prices with inflation

image.altText: Two young people sit on the ground in handcuffs while a third is laying down while being arrested. Police stand nearby.

props.synopsis: Youth crime has been hitting the headlines, but what does the long-term data show? An analysis of crime data shows offender rates have risen for the first time in 14 years, as Australia wrestles with how to manage children who are both victims and criminals.

title.children: 'We're losing a generation of kids' as youth offender rates increase for first time in more than a decade

image.altText: An aerial image shows a circled patch of dark blue in the middle of an ocean with small green islands surrounding.

props.synopsis: Legend has it a jealous husband used a wave curse to sink Teonimenu into the ocean forever. Scientists have worked out what really happened.

title.children: Why this sunken island is changing the way we think about myths

image.altText: Rectangular bales of plastic recyclables stacked on top of each other.

props.synopsis: A levy due to be imposed on rubbish being sent offshore for recycling will be formally scrapped in next week's federal budget as the federal government responds to warnings it would have sent more waste to landfill.

title.children: 'Recycling tax' to be scrapped in federal budget after warnings it would send more waste to landfill

image.altText: Shenanee wearing a short with orange, green and purple gradient, standing on a pier by the water.

props.synopsis: In 2017, Shenane Hogg woke from a nine-month induced coma following an attack from her then-partner. The incident had been the last in a series of physical assaults, but she says the first red flag in the relationship was much more subtle.

title.children: Shenane woke from a coma to find she was $56,000 in debt. This is how she fought her way back

image.altText: A woman holds her head in her hands

props.synopsis: Attendees at the crisis talks on murdered and missing women say they have got the answers to help stop the scourge but they need governments to walk the walk, not just talk the talk, if they are serious about ending it.

title.children: 'We have reached saturation point on consultation': Experts call for action to address gendered violence

image.altText: RBA governor Michele Bullock holds her hand up while speaking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: As surging prices for essentials continue to drive stubborn inflation, it's still anyone's guess as to how far households and businesses will need to be screwed down by the RBA's interest rate hammer to get the rising cost of living under control.

title.children: Michele Bullock has one tool to fight inflation, and right now it looks particularly blunt

image.altText: Prince Harry and King Charles side-by-side

props.synopsis: A spokesperson for the Duke of Sussex confirms that the pair will not meet during Prince Harry's current trip to Britain.

title.children: King Charles is too busy to see his son Prince Harry, who hopes to see him 'soon'

image.altText: Storms clouds gather and spread along the Sydney coast

props.synopsis: Rain and more rain is predicted for New South Wales over the next six days, with parts of the state potentially facing floods and Sydney to experience its longest wet spell in decades.

title.children: Flooding on cards for parts of NSW as rain tipped to continue falling into this weekend

image.altText: Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams prepare for the flight.

props.synopsis: Boeing badly needs a space win for its Starliner venture, a years-delayed program with more than $US1 billion in cost overruns.

title.children: Boeing's Starliner capsule set for first crewed space flight in rivalry with SpaceX

image.altText: A modern apartment complex with balconies as seen through trees.

props.synopsis: Lodging complexes are a cost-effective and supportive model of community housing, and there are calls for governments to build more of them in a bid to alleviate the homelessness crisis.

title.children: Call for governments to invest more in lodging houses in bid to alleviate homelessness crisis

image.altText: Jim Chalmers at a press conference with his mouth closed.

props.synopsis: After three budget updates in which Jim Chalmers has spent less than previously forecast, in this next budget, for at least some of the years for which he will produce projections, he will spend more.

title.children: The RBA is warning of stubborn inflation, but Chalmers knows 'slashing and burning' in the budget could spell disaster

image.altText: An orange sunset in a cloudy sky over the rocky shoreline of Saibai

props.synopsis: Five men are in custody on Saibai Island in the Torres Strait after being caught crossing into Australia illegally.

title.children: Five men in custody after being caught crossing illegally into Australia

image.altText: Jake Fraser-McGurk looks over his shoulder

props.synopsis: Australia's decision to leave Jake Fraser-McGurk out of its T20 World Cup squad surprised several onlookers. The burgeoning opening batter wasn't one of them.

title.children: One of Australian cricket's brightest young talents will miss the World Cup, but Ricky Ponting is unlocking his full potential

image.altText: Illuminated logos of Coles and Woolworths outside of each supermarket in a shopping centre.

props.synopsis: A Greens-led Senate inquiry on supermarket pricing calls for hefty fines for grocers who mistreat suppliers, but recommendations to forcibly break-up retailers and make price gouging illegal fail to attract broad support.

title.children: Supermarkets inquiry calls for hefty fines for grocers who mistreat suppliers

image.altText: An excerpt of a blue line graph shows Victoria's net debt over time.

props.synopsis: The Victorian budget has forecast more debt, but how bad is it? Here are seven charts to help make sense of the state's economy.

title.children: Grasping billions of dollars of debt can be tricky — we've broken down Victoria's budget with these graphs

image.altText: Prawns on a bed of ice.

props.synopsis: Prawns off Queensland's northern coast will be tasty and fresh in supermarkets this season, but fishermen are still reeling from Sea Swift's mothership suspension, forcing fuel and supply costs to rise.

title.children: Prawn fishermen focusing on quality over quantity in Gulf as suspension of support services hits bottom line

image.altText: Two men wearing military uniforms hold a man in civilian clothes. All faces are burred.

props.synopsis: Ukraine's primary internal security agency says it has detained two men over an alleged Russian plot to assassinate president Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

title.children: Ukraine arrests two security officials over alleged Russian plot to assassinate Zelenskyy

image.altText: Vladimir Putin holds his hand on a red book in front of a screen showing the Russian flag colours of red, white and blue

props.synopsis: Australia was among a number of other Western countries that did not attend Vladimir Putin's presidential inauguration due to Russia's war in Ukraine.

title.children: Russia's Vladimir Putin sworn in for fifth presidential term as Australia boycotts ceremony

image.altText: A book with the title Same-Sex parents featuring two men and a young boy

props.synopsis: A slim majority of Cumberland City councillors voted to remove the book from its libraries in a meeting last week.

title.children: Western Sydney libraries could lose state funding after council votes to ban same-sex parenting book

image.altText: Fiona Horne looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Musician, author and witch Fiona Horne flew from the US to headline Australia's Gathering of the Goddesses festival. She says the now-in-liquidation female empowerment festival was "poorly run and mismanged".

title.children: Promised a 'glamping tent' to stay in, artist for failed 'goddesses' festival says she was given a first aid room instead

image.altText: A smiling older couple wearing matching lanyards.

props.synopsis: Alleged attempted murder victim Ross Tighe, who has post-traumatic stress disorder, will have to face questioning at the trial of the man accused of killing his mother, stepfather and brother in Queensland in 2022.

title.children: 'Crucial witness': Court orders sole survivor of triple shooting to face cross-examination

image.altText: Composite image of Tyla, Doja Cat, Lizzo and Chris Hemsworth attending the 2024 Met Gala.

props.synopsis: You've seen all the Met Gala looks, now it's time for the experts' review on the couture of it all.

title.children: Four Australian fashion icons help us unpack the Met Gala
